alert.note: Alert for East Central Plains (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Fire Weather Watch issued February 19 at 2:53AM MST until February 20 at 7:00PM MST by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...FIRE WEATHER WATCH IN EFFECT SUNDAY FOR THE EAST CENTRAL PLAINS DUE TO VERY DRY, WINDY AND UNSTABLE CONDITIONS... .Increasing westerlies and a deepening lee side trough, combined with very dry conditions and an unstable atmosphere, will bring several hours of critical fire weather conditions to the east central plains on Sunday. ...FIRE WEATHER WATCH IN EFFECT FROM SUNDAY MORNING THROUGH SUNDAY EVENING... The National Weather Service in Albuquerque has issued a Fire Weather Watch...which is in effect from Sunday morning through Sunday evening. * AREA AND TIMING...East central plains late Sunday morning through early Sunday evening. * 20 FOOT WINDS...Westerly 15 to 25 mph with occasional gusts to 35 mph. * RELATIVE HUMIDITY...8-13 percent. * IMPACTS...Any fires that develop will likely spread rapidly. Outdoor burning is not recommended.
info.instruction: Please advise the appropriate officials or fire crews in the field of this Fire Weather Watch.
